newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIAN COMMERCIAL BANK CUTS INTEREST RATES.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIAN COMMERCIAL BANK CUTS INTEREST RATES.

text.p: Romanian state-run bank Banca Comerciala Romana SA (BCR) announced on Monday cuts in interest rates on leu deposits and credits in line with slower inflation and to stimulate economic recovery.
The bank slashed short-term lending rates to an annual 46 percent from 53 percent starting Monday.
It said the BCR would charge 40 percent annual interest for export-bound credits, down from a previous 43 percent.
The BCR's rate on individuals' sight deposits also fell to 14 from 15 percent, while three-month deposit rates carried 43 percent annual interest, down from 53 percent previously.
Six-month deposit rates dropped to an annual 46 percent from 58 percent, while 12-month deposits rate fell by 12 percentage points to 50 percent.

Romania's monthly inflation hit a record low of 0.7 percent last month, down from 2.3 percent in June and an all-time high of 30.7 percent in March when prices of fuel, energy and staples were liberalised.
